text: MŠK Považská Bystrica is a Slovak football team, based in the town of Považská Bystrica. The club was founded in 1920 as SK Považská Bystrica and played in the Czechoslovak First League four times, the last time being the 1989–90 season, but never in the Corgoň liga, the first Slovak championship. ==Previous names== referencehttp://mskpb.eu/klub/info/ * 1920–1924: ŠK * 1924–1926: Orol * 1924–1926: ŠK * 1933–1936: ŠK Munička * 1936–1948 : AC Sparta * 1948–1953 : Sokol Manet * 1953–1966 : Spartak * 1966–1968 : Sparta * 1968–1990 : ZVL * 1990–1997 : FK Sparta * 1997–2013 : FK Raven * 2013– : MŠK == Club history == The main club sponsor Raven company ended support of the football team in Považská Bystrica, even though the club was in first place in Majstrovstvá regiónu 2012/2013 (4th level) competition after the autumn season. So the club was dissolved due to financial crisis after losing its main sponsor. ==Honours== Czechoslovakia * 1.SNL (1st Slovak National football league) (1969–1993) ** 15px Winners (2): 1969–70, 1988–89 * Slovak League (1939–44) ** 15px Winners (1): 1938–39 Slovakia * Slovak Cup (1961–) ** 15px Runners-up (1): 1989 == Current squad == == External links == *Official website * *Unofficial website ==References== Category:Football clubs in Slovakia Category:Czechoslovak First League clubs Category:Association football clubs established in 1920 MSK Povazska Bystrica
title: MŠK Považská Bystrica (football)
